docs.text: there are scenes in " the big hit " that are so awful , they simply defy description .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the movie is infected with the same kind of blunderheaded idiocy and misplaced confidence that made " last action hero " ( 1993 ) such a chore to sit through .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: presumably , " the big hit " is an action-comedy , a difficult but not impossible genre to pull off .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: movies of this sort require a fine balance and careful tone , and the comedy is usually meant to work as catharsis for the violence .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: " lethal weapon 2 " ( 1989 ) is a perfect example of an action thriller that was also very , very funny .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: unfortunately , in " the big hit , " it seems that comedy is the main motive , and the violence is only intended to punctuate the laughs .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: unfortunately , there are no laughs .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the movie resembles some of the goofy , throwaway ridiculousness of early jackie chan films , but it doesn't benefit from chan's incredible stunts and goofy , charismatic presence .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: instead , we are left with a lot of digital effects and mark wahlberg , who must have considered himself invincible after his critically-acclaimed performance in last year's " boogie nights . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: however , if he wants to maintain a decent career , he had better start selecting his projects more carefully - movies like this are a sure-fire recipe for a long career in the straight-to-video market .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: wahlberg plays melvin smiley , an amiable guy who also happens to be a professional hitman ( see " grosse pointe blank " for the same character , much better developed ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the movie wants us to think , " gee how clever and ironic - a guy who can kill without any moral implications , and yet he can't stand for anyone not to like him . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the fact is , melvin is so desperate to keep people from not liking him , that he puts up with both an obnoxious fiancee ( christina applegate , with a horrendous new york accent ) and an abusive girlfriend ( lela rochon ) who is only using him for his money .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: his constant bending over backwards to please people makes him a complete patsy at best , and a thoroughly unbelievable character at worst .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: melvin is employed exclusively by a crime boss named paris ( avery brooks ) as part of a team of hitmen , which also includes cisco ( lou diamond phillips ) and crunch ( bokeem woodbine ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: one day , melvin agrees to do some moonlighting with cisco by kidnapping the teenage daughter of a rich japanese mogul named jiro nishi ( sab shimono ) for a million dollar ransom .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: however , not only has jiro nishi lost all his money producing a big hollywood movie ( inside joke , get it ? ) , but his kidnapped daughter , keiko ( china chow ) , also happens to be paris' goddaughter .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: so , when paris finds out she's been kidnapped , he takes it personally and becomes determined to find out who did it .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: not knowing the cisco is actually behind the whole scheme , paris puts him in charge of rooting out the kidnapper .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: of course cisco blames the whole thing on poor , innocent melvin .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: along the way , there are several obligatory gunfights , explosions , and car chases , plus a literal cliffhanger inspired by " jurassic park , " and a completely unconvincing romance between melvin and keiko ( who looks like she's barely pushing fifteen ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: what the movie passes off as humor resorts to thoroughly unfunny jokes about overweight jewish mothers , hara-kiri , drinking problems , leaking body bags , and a running gag about how crunch has recently discovered the pleasures of masturbation , and now spends all his time doing hand exercises .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: not to mention the pimply video store clerk who is always calling melvin and screeching about how he needs to return his copy of " king kong lives , " which is two weeks overdue .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this mess of a movie was helmed by che-kirk wong , the latest hong kong director imported by john woo ( " face/off " ) , who also served as executive producer .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: woo needs to stop acting as a conduit for other directors , and start making more of his own films .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: wong , who directed such films as " rock'n'roll cop " back in hong kong , is completely tone deaf when it comes to comedy .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: maybe jokes about vexatious video clerks and vomiting on other people are funny across the ocean , but they're not here , at least in the manner wong handles them .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: many of the problems can be traced back to the script , which was penned by obvious freshman writer ben ramsey .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in addition to his vague characterizations and uninspired action sequences , ramsey's script assaults the audience with his attempts to copy the vulgar , poetic rhythms of tarantino or mamet-style dialogue .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: what he comes out with is just a lot of annoying blather , most of which spews from the lips of lou diamond phillips ( whose favorite phrase is " it's all love " ) and robin dunne , who plays cisco's stuttering , black-wannabe assistant .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the irritation factor of phillips and dunne combined is almost off the scale , which can pretty much describe the film as a whole .
docs.label: negative
